name: Aboard the Lookinglass
description:
Winner of the IndieCade 3D Jam, Official Selection for Out of Index Festival in South Korea and selected for the European Innovative Games Showcase in Cologne. Lookinglass also enjoyed a stint at the Museum of the Moving Image in New York, and was showcased at the Internet Festival, Pisa, Italy in October 2015.

A science-fiction game about dimensional time, a rescue mission gone awry and a troubling future.

View the trailer here: https://youtu.be/t46-nzisJa8

Full gameplay video (skips intro): http://youtu.be/LX9i7ULY8uw?t=1m14s
Warning: spoilers. Useful if you get stuck or can't play the game.

You come round with a hazy memory and a voice crackling down your intercom, "Alice… Alice can you hear me". You recognise the voice… you just can't remember, who, or where. Panic rises, but the voice is calming, reassuring. You have a mission. You're part of a rescue team. Yes, it all makes sense.

Peering through your left hand you see another world, or time. The past.

Your right hand holds the future.

Looking round, you see a screen, hissing and fractured. "This must have once opened the door", you think. Once. In the past. Raising your left hand, a working screen slides into view. You press it in the past. The door murmurs, then pops open in the present.

Built from scratch for #3DJam
Created by Henry Hoffman
Voiceover by Matthew Wade
Source sound effects and music from Audio Jungle

A big thanks to the Leap folk which answered all my technical questions, and everyone else who helped run the jam. Also thanks to Dan Da Rocha for lending me his Oculus Rift, and Tony Phipps and Chris Rowe for letting me crunch at their house.
